channel.title: sitespeed.io release feed
channel.description: New releases and changelog feed of sitespeed.io
channel.copyright: All rights reserved 2022, Peter Hedenskog and team

item.title: sitespeed.io 31.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Hopefully removing "rsd" metrics in InfluxDB see #4039.
  • Fix showing sustainable metrics in pages page #4042.

item.title: sitespeed.io 31.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • The new version of Browsertime also fix the bug in Firefox 121 on Mac so you can start it.

item.title: browsertime 20.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Firefox 121 in the Docker container.g

Fixed

  • Group page load parameters as PageLoad to make them easier to find using --help #2035.
  • Fix starting Firefox 121 on Mac #2043.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.11.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded the Docker container to use Firefox 121 #4033.
  • Updated to Browsertime 19.3.0 #4031.

Fixed

  • Moved functionality from co2 to sitespeed.io see #4034.

item.title: browsertime 19.3.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Ensure that visual metrics python script is included in the release.

item.title: browsertime 19.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated Chromedriver and Edgedriver to 120 #2033.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.10.0
item.description:
Added

  • Add isSignificant metric to send to Graphite when using the compare plugin. Will send 0 if there's no siginificant change, else send the Cliffs delta to know how large the change is #4030.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.9.0
item.description:
Added

  • Chrome and Edge 120 in the Docker container #4027.
  • Updated to Browsertime 19.2.0.
  • For users of the +1 container Lighthouse has been upgraded to 11.4.0.

item.title: browsertime 19.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to Chrome and Edge 120 in the Docker container #2031.

Fixed

  • Updated to Selenium 4.16.0 #2026.
  • Updated dev dependencies and find-up #2029.
  • Recommend NodeJS 18 or later in the package.json #2030. Browsertime 16.0.0 removed support for NodeJS 16.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.8.0
item.description:
Added

  • Use Cliffs delta to know the size of the significant change #4024.
  • Show if the graph has a siginficant change or not in the compare plugin #4025.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.7.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • The old settings for MannWhitneyU tests where confusing. We compared the the baseline is less than the current tests. This PR switched so we instead look if the current tests are greater than the baseline. We also added some better explaining text on result page#4023.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.7.0
item.description:
Added

  • Show Axe individual issues on the page summary (not only on each individual run) #4019. Thank you shaqb for pointing that out. The total number of issues is also sent to Graphite under statistics.axe.violationIssues.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.6.0
item.description:
Added

  • Make sure browser cpu benchmark is included in the baseline #4015.
  • Fixed so baseline metrics is linked to graphs #4016.

Fixed

  • Fix decimals on Google Web Vitals in baseline #4014.

item.title: sitespeed.io 30.5.0
item.description:
Added

  • The new compare plugin can now run without an id. The id will then be generated from the URL. If you don't give it an id, yoiu can only compare pages with the exact same URL #4013.

item.title: browsertime 19.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Firefox 120 in the Docker container.

Fixed

  • New Geckodriver installer that on Mac ARM uses ARM version of Geckodriver.

item.title: browsertime 19.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • Largest contentful paint and First contentful paint in Firefox now also fills the "googleWebitals" fields in the results. Thank you Gregory Mierzwinski for PR #2018 and my PR #2020.
  • Make sure --android.pinCPUSpeed works #2019

item.title: browsertime 18.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated all dev-dependencies to latest versions #2013.
  • Updated GitHub Actions to use latest versions of actions and Ubuntu 22.04 #2012, #2014 and #2016
  • Updated all dependencies to latest versions: ADB kit 3.2.5 #2017, execa, dayjs, get-port and Chromedriver #2015.

item.title: browsertime 17.19.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to Chrome, Firefox and Edge 119 in the Docker container #2010.
  • Updated to Edgedriver 119.

Fixed

  • Updated to Selenium 4.15.0 #2011.

item.title: browsertime 17.18.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • WebDriver 4.14.0
  • Chromedriver 119.0.6045-59

item.title: browsertime 17.18.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to Chromedriver 119 #2003. 119 works with both Chrome 118 and 119 so it fixes #1197.
  • Add support for network idle method to know when to end a test that uses network logs. Uses Bidi for Firefox and CDP for Chrome to listen on network events to know when to end a test. By default 5 seconds idle network time ends a tests (you could have network responses that hasn't arrived yet) #1960. Potentially this can help SPA users or users where the page uses iframes. You can try it out by adding --pageCompleteCheckNetworkIdle yo your command line. This is still some work in progress but feel free to try ut out.
  • The resources script now collects number of resources served from the browser cashe for browser that supports that through the resource timing API #1998

Fixed

  • Make sure timer always is cleared. There was case of where we do a rase beteween a promise and a timeout where the timeout timer wasn't cleared/removed #2005.
  • Better way to get the url when you use GeckoProfiler.stop for Firefox, thank you Nazım Can Altınova for PR #1999

item.title: coach-core 8.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Another update to PageXray with a safer HTTP header check.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated PageXray.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.4
item.description:
Fixed

  • Added a safer header check #125.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • If the meta section from a HAR file from Browsertime was missing, we didn't catch that. Fixed in #124.
  • Update to latest minimist #122.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Expose third party web and wappalyzer versions #111.

Fixed

  • Updated to Wappalyzer 6.10.66 #110.
  • Updated third party web 0.24.0 #108.
  • Fix correct LCP attribute #107.

Changed

  • Remove advice about disableFLoCHeader #106.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated tough-cookie, thank you lallenlowe for PR #107.

item.title: coach-core 7.2.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Catch if local storage or session storage isn't accessible.

item.title: coach-core 7.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to third party web 0.23.0. #98.
  • Upgraded to latest wappalyzer #100.

Fixed

  • Make sure to skip advice if Chrome is missing FCP #95.
  • Update dev dependencies

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated dependencies to latest versions #105.
  • Remove adding headers from extra parameters. Using the CDP Fetch API manipulating responses, the extra response info holds the old un-manipulated headers, so when copying the ones that do not exist, this breaks. Fixed in #100.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed exporting to work with ESM modules too.

item.title: throttle 5.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • Dropped support for NodeJS 12 since it's unmaintaned.

item.title: throttle 4.0.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed --version so it actually shows the version again #75.

item.title: throttle 4.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • The E6 Module convertion in 4.0 broke version check (--version) making installs failed. PR #74 is a temporaty fix for that.

item.title: throttle 4.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed the dependecy of route. Using ip route instead and we already have ip as a requirement.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.4.2 and Third Party Web 0.17.1.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Added missing SSL timings to the time per domain #117

item.title: throttle 3.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated minimist dependency.

item.title: throttle 4.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated dev dependencies to latest versions #68

Changed

  • Converting the project to ES6 module. If you run Throttle by command line it will work exactly as before except that we dropped support for NodeJS 10 #67. You can read Sindre Sorhus ESM package guide.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.4.1 and Third Party Web 0.15.0.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Bumped minimist to 1.2.6

item.title: coach-core 7.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.0.0.
  • Upgraded to third party web 0.13.0.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Fallback if mime types aren't mapped and use file endings. At the moment we fallback for some of the font types #109.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.0
item.description:
Added

  • Add _isLinkPreload on the request object if it is isLinkPreload #94.

item.title: throttle 3.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Add support for setting packet loss. Add --packetLoss and set the loss in percentage.

item.title: coach-core 7.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated third-party-web to 0.12.6.
  • Use Chrome(ium) render blocking information to know if a request is render blocking or not #66.
  • Report offending JavaScript assets if the JavaScript max limits kicks in #70.
  • New largest contentful paint advice #76.
  • New first contentful paint advice #77.
  • Added TBT in the CPU longtask advice #80.
  • Report content and transfer size for offending URLs #81.
  • Report offending assets with transfer/content size for page size limit #82.

Fixed

  • Fix cases when JQuery is undefined. Thank you shubham jajodia for PR #64.
  • A better way to find offending layout shifters. Thank you shubham jajodia for PR #65.
  • Removed mentions aboout server push #69
  • Added more information on how to debug CPU advice #71.

Changed

  • Moved AMP advice to best practice instead of privacy #67.
  • Increased favicon max size advice from 5 to 10 kb #68
  • Renamed the fastRender advice to avoidRenderBlocking #73
  • Remove the third party async advice #74
  • Updated the layout shift advice to use cumulative layout shift #75
  • Changed id of the Google Tag Manager advice #79

item.title: coach 7.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Coach core and Browertime.

item.title: coach 6.4.3
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Browsertime with latest Chromedriver
  • Updated Docker container to use latest Chrome/Firefox
  • Use Browsertime 11.0.0
  • Use Coach-code 6.0
  • Use latest Firefox and Chrome

item.title: throttle 3.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • When you run on Mac OS we changed so localhost traffic is not throttled by default. To throttle on localhost use --localhost. This makes sence if you use WebDriver to drive your browser on your local machine. And Mac OS now works the same as Linux.

item.title: throttle 2.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix breakage when multiple default routes are declared , thank you Andy Richardson for PR #62.

item.title: pagexray 4.3.1
item.description:
Added

  • Added missing in_body_parser_blocking render blocking info for Chrome.

item.title: pagexray 4.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Include request method per asset #105.

item.title: pagexray 4.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Attach info about render blocking assets coming/working in Chrome 92 #104.

item.title: pagexray 4.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Attach Google Web Vitals data from Browsertime #101.

item.title: throttle 2.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • A better check for missing net-tools on Linux, thank you Radu Micu for the PR #56.

item.title: pagexray 4.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • The new header structure actually sucked. Instead follow other tools and flatten headers returning an array #98.

item.title: chrome-har 0.11.12
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed test directory from the release, thank you Yury Michurin for the PR #75.

item.title: chrome-har 0.11.11
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix: Optional cookie object, see PR 73. Thank you Michael Dijkstra.

item.title: chrome-har 0.11.10
item.description:
Added

  • Parse extra info events (parse extra request data from the Network.requestWillBeSentExtraInfo event and parse extra response data from the Network.responseReceivedExtraInfo event), thank you Michael Dijkstra for the PR #71.
  • Update to day-js 1.8.31.

item.title: chrome-har 0.11.9
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated dependencies: dayjs - 1.8.27, debug: 4.1.1, tough-cookie - 4.0.0, uuid - 8.0.0

item.title: coach 5.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • We moved out the core functionality to coach-core. This makes it easy to use the Coach in your own code.

item.title: coach 4.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to Browsertime 8.0.1

item.title: humble 0.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated throttle frontend to latest version where you can see throttling profiles set by using the API and with custom throttling support.

item.title: compare 1.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Added support for using Github gists see #34.
  • Added support for using a config file to configure which HARs to test.
  • Added support for copy/paste directly you HAR, configuration file or a gist URL or id.
  • Refactor the CSS into Sass, development build process now uses BrowserSync.
  • Service worker added for offline support. Workbox is used to achieve this.
  • Added support for showing changes in request/responses if you compare the same page #63.

Changed

  • New internal structure and use the new configuration object all the way.

item.title: compare 0.6.0
item.description:
Added

  • Sort CPU events by name to make it easier to spot regressions
  • Upgraded to latest release of template7
  • Added more Visual Metrics.
  • Upgrad to PageXray 2.4.0

item.title: compare 0.5.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Layout -> Rendering in latest Browsertime.
  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.5.2 fixiing Edge tab bug

item.title: compare 0.5.0
item.description:
Added

  • CPU metrics are now showed automatically.
  • Styled the PageXray info table to make it easier to read.

item.title: compare 0.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Major code refactoring to make it easier to do changes in the future.
  • Uploading files failed on Firefox.

item.title: compare 0.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.4.1
  • You can change/upload HAR files when you already compare two HARs.

Fixed

  • The layout in the PageXray table was dependent of the length of the URL. That could make some pages look really bad.

item.title: compare 0.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Automatically load the HAR files if both files are given in the URL . Thanks Ivru for the PR #15.
  • You can automatically load one HAR file by adding ?har1=URL&compare=1 as the full URL.
  • Updated to PageXray 2.2.1
  • You can now drag and drop one HAR file with multiple pages and compare the pages with each others #16.

item.title: compare 0.2.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.2.2 that makes HAR files from WebPageTest Linux render
  • Log errors to the console

item.title: compare 0.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to PageXray 2.1.0 and added more CPU metrics
